commentary_on_process:
To solve the problem, I first found the number of households by subtracting the number of families from the total number of households. The number of households is 43,507, and the number of families is 29,889. Therefore, the number of households more than families is 43,507 - 29,889 = 13,618. 

To solve the problem better, I could have used a calculator to perform the subtraction more quickly and accurately. Additionally, I could have double-checked my calculations to ensure that I did not make any errors.
final_answer: The number of households more than families is 13,618.
problem_text:
Context:
As of the 2000 United States Census, there were 128,094 people, 43,507 households, and 29,889 families residing in the county. The population density was 110 people per square mile (43/km²). There were 56,377 housing units at an average density of 49 per square mile (19/km²). The racial makeup of the county was 28.90% Race (U.S. census), 1.40% Race (U.S. census) or Race (U.S. census), 0.37% Race (U.S. census), 33.01% Race (U.S. census), 10.72% Race (U.S. census), 1.36% from race (U.S. census), and 22.24% from two or more races. 7.8% of the population were Race (U.S. census) or Race (U.S. census) of any race.

Question:
How many more households are there than families?
